sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The paragraph Embedded Text Widget (ETW) allows you to produce a number of paragraphs within your document that are formatted like an outline.
For example, sometimes it is desirable to create a set of numbered paragraphs. Although this widget does not do automatic numbering, it does take care of indenting the paragraphs correctly.
Like all ETW's, there is a main menu in the upper left part of the widget where all the widget's functionality can be accessed.

listitem.para: This entry contains a number and indicates how many levels deep this paragraph should be intended. For example, the first paragraph, and all paragraphs like it should be numbered "1". Sub-paragraphs of these paragraphs should be numbered "2". Sub-sub-paragraphs should be numbered "3", etc.
These indent levels can be incremented or decremented with the spinner buttons just to the right of the entry.

This entry (the larger one on the right) can contain an optional title that will be shown at the beginning of the paragraph. The title, if present, will hang out to the left of the paragraph when formatted.
For example, main paragraphs, might have titles: 1., 2., 3., etc. For example, sub-paragraphs, might have titles: a., b., c., and so on.
